Tucson looks to Talon and then offers his back to her. 

" Here, you should=
 take it easy, Talon.  Get on, I'll walk you back to the Ark."

Local artis=
t who specializes in illustration, using traditional and digital media.

nico <magicquartz@...> wrote:

ow nothing about this enemy and to charge him blindly and head on, would be=

> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups=
.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Tucson looks to t=
he paintings thoughtfully. 
> > > > 
> > > > " Yes, I believe you're right =
Talon. These depictions tell all. And if this so called other deity is a ph=
ysical being, then it must be evil, or else it wouldn't be painted in black=
. And if it is a physical being, it must be stopped. And I have a feeling t=
hat perhaps its best if I face this being personally. Now, let's see... Thi=
s pictograph gives a location.. Ah, I got it, these paintings resemble a pa=
th that I happen to know rather well. And some of this writing.. I think it=
 means " Blight" . Tucson to base, over. I have identified an enemy, via pi=
ctograph images found on my location. The name of our new enemy is Blight, =
and by the look of the pictographs, he is a Predacon. I will proceed to loc=
ate Blight now . Or at least get him to heed my warning. Tucson out."
> > >=
 > 
> > > > He narrows his eyes, leaps up onto a large boulder and gives of=
f his thunderous roar, hoping that Blight gets the message.
> > > > 
> > > =

al media.

r any occasion!

No problem! Email me at this address and we will talk.

> > > > 
> > > > > Talon=
:
> > > > > 
> > > > > talon ate the fish and looked athe paint and said "D=
o they think that you are actually a sort of deity as well as the other one=
?"
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magic=
quartz@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Tucson embraces Talon with his tail=
 around her shoulders.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > " So will I. Talon, so will=
 I. But that doesn't mean we can't try to recreate a little portion of life=
 on our own planet. This seed we were given, it needs soil, water, light an=
d something to plant it in. Perhaps we can find a place where there is an a=
bundance of soil and take that with us. "
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Just as =
he spoke, a Protohuman, carrying an offering of fish, kneels down before Tu=
cson and Talon. Tucson looks to the offering. It was a most generous portio=
n of fish. Yet now he could not eat it, but he knew Talon would need nouris=
hment. He nods gently to the Protohuman and accepts his offering with a gen=
tile touch of his nose on the man's shoulder. He allows him to stroke his s=
nout as some sort of good luck ritual. The man bows in graciousness to Tucs=
on's gesture of kindness and leaves him be with Talon.
> > > > > > 
> > > >=
 > > " I'm not so sure what all of that meant but, whatever it was, it was =
a very kind gesture on his part. I wonder if these people had any interacti=
on with the old Silver Dragon.. " 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > It isn't long b=
efore others come to offer more gifts to him and Talon. One of the Protohum=
ans points to a painting on a rock, with white portraying silver, in a prim=
itive image of a large reptile with outstretched wings.
> > > > > > 
> > > =
> > > " Oh, I see now.. Yes, they have seen him before. To them he is a gua=
rdian, and the more offerings they gave him, he would return their kind ges=
tures by offering his protection. But there is more to these paintings.. A =
strange mysterious figure, with an aura around it.. To me it seems evil. An=
other idol, someone else to worship. .. People portrayed in black and white=
.. White, meaning those who look to the Silver Dragon and black to those wh=
o worship the intimidating idol.. I've seen ancient pictographs before on C=
ybertron, and these are different but in the same format. Talon if the drag=
on is a physical being, then this dark idol must be as well. We need to fin=
d it, before it lays harm to anyone."
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Local artist=
 who specializes in illustration, using traditional and digital media. 
> >=
 > > > > 
> > > > > > I also specialize in hand made crafts. Great for any =
occasion! 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Need a great gift idea that is original=
? No problem! Email me at this address and we will talk. 
> > > > > > 
> > =
> > > > On Jun 20, 2012, at 3:57 AM, "C" <airly2002@> wrote:
> > > > > > 
>=
 > > > > > > Talon 
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > The femme smiled when she =
saw all those things and said softly "I will miss all this"
> > > > > > > 
=
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@> w=
rote:
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > With a gentile smile, Tucson returns =
the kiss and holds his wing over them to provide a moment alone with Talon.=
 After the kiss he lowers his wing and notices that a collection of small c=
reatures surrounding him and Talon . Yet they do so in a fashion of admirat=
ion rather than hostility. Tucson looks to them curiously.
> > > > > > > > =

> > > > > > > > " I'm not sure why these creatures are curious about us bu=
t it appears as if they're here to admire rather than attack. I wonder... "=

> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > He stands up and gets back into beast mod=
e, and sits down once more. The creatures draw closer to him and sit beside=
 him and Talon. It was clear that the Silver Dragon was a source of comfort=
 to these creatures, but that was about to change once he and Talon left fo=
r Cybertron. It was a massive guilt slammed upon his heart. Yet how could h=
e get the animals to understand that he had to leave them in such a short t=
ime? He was now their guardian and they were looking up to him for protecti=
on. 
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > " Talon, these creatures remember the=
 old dragon that sought to their protection and realize that I have taken h=
is place. It's as I thought, they aren't aware of who we really are, and wh=
ere we are from. They will not understand that we must leave them shortly, =
for good, and Primus knows what will happen to them once we leave. ... Talo=
n, I hear something coming. It's not a Predacon but it's a fairly large cre=
ature."
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Not far from them, Tucson spots th=
e scales of a rather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the strea=
m next to them. He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature lif=
ts its head. It was another dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than he =
was, but the same coloration. He takes note of its slender shape. It was fe=
male. She looks to him as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and th=
ey look gently to each other like brother and sister. In draconic vocalizat=
ion, Tucson explains who he is and his dilemma. She intern rumbles back and=
 bows her head. She nods as he does. It was their way of communicating as T=
ucson looks back to Talon.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > " Apparently th=
e old dragon has family here. They are scattered but they exist. And she sa=
id that she will protect these creatures and this land along with her breth=
ren for as long as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our journey."
=
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > With that, the dragoness leaves them peace=
fully to enjoy their time together. With a gentile groan, the creatures too=
, depart. It was truly a spiritual moment for both of them.
> > > > > > > >=
 
> > > > > > > > Local artist who specializes in illustration, using tradi=
tional and digital media.

>=
 > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@=
> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Tucson holds Talon gently =
with an arm around her shoulders. He looks up and then back to her.
> > > >=
 > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > " Like a branch on a tree that has broken=
 off during a storm and regrows in a different direction than it had been, =
before it had broken off. I know exactly how you feel. I feel the same way.=
 At one time, I was blind, rolled on four wheels and I always seemed to be =
an Autobot rebel. I fought along side with my comrades but I wasn't good at=
 following orders. I was well grounded but lost at the same time. Then, I m=
et you and things began to change on a more positive note. You may not beli=
eve this, but you helped me to find my path, and you saw me on the right ro=
ad and guided me to my true fate. Soon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquir=
ed seventeen more wheels, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, yet differe=
nt. But one thing didn't change, I was still battling blindness off and on.=
 Then, a third change, due to extensive damage to my previous form, which c=
ould not be repaired, I was guided to my final evolution, this one. All of =
these things wouldn't have come about if I had never met you. And I wouldn'=
t have it any other way. Talon, I will miss this planet as much as you are,=
 and hopefully we can tell our offspring all about this planet and it's won=
drous varieties of life that live here."
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > >=
 > > > The rodent climbs down and drops a nut into his hand, and chatters t=
o him.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > " This is for us to keep? T=
hank you, we will take good care of it."
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > >=
 > > > He places the nut in Talon's hand.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > =
> > > > " I think we have a way to bring back a small reminder of this plan=
et. Let's see if we can encourage it to grow on ours."

 > > > > > > > > Tucson puts a gentile arm around Talon's shoulders and loo=
ks up into the branches of the tree, but finds himself bonked on the head b=
y a tree nut, which is dropped by a rodent. He chuckles and gives the nut b=
ack to the rodent.
> > > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > " You d=
ropped this."
> > > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > The rodent t=
akes the nut back and vanishes into the tree to eat its prize. Tucson was o=
ne with the creatures and it was obvious that they were comfortable around =
him. 
> > > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > " Talon, I'm going t=
o miss this planet just as much as you are, when we leave for Cybertron. It=
's just not going to feel like home the way this planet does. But Leo is ri=
ght, we can not remain here and upset the balance of time. But while we're =
still here, let's enjoy the moment and continue to explore this part of the=
 forest."
